newsitem.title: UK: British Conservative MP dies, Major in minority.
newsitem.headline: British Conservative MP dies, Major in minority.

text.p: Iain Mills, a member of parliament for Britain's ruling Conservative Party, has died, the Press Association news agency said on Thursday.

His death means Prime Minister John Major is clearly in a minority in parliament as the Conservatives have 322 MPs and the combined opposition have 323. Mills, MP for Meriden in central England, had a 14,699 majority at the 1992 election.
An election must be held by May 22 but Major may have to call a snap poll if he is defeated in parliament.
Major has hinted he wants to hold out until May before calling an election as he hopes improved economic conditions will persuade voters to re-elect the Conservatives.
The main opposition Labour party leads in opinion polls by about 20 points. A parliamentary by-election is already pending in north-west England following the death of another Conservative MP.
